Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Los Angeles

Private Litigation Case Title: Dolins et al v. Continental Casualty Company

Description: Continental Casaulty and other CNA subsidiaries agreed to pay $5.75 million to settle claims relating to workers compensation surcharges.

Company: American Casualty Company of Reading, Pennsylvania
National Fire Insurance Company of Hartford
CNA Insurance Companies and Continental Casualty Co.
The Continental Insurance Co. et al.

Description: CNA Group companies American Casualty Company of Reading, Pennsylvania, Continental Casualty Co., The Continental Insurance Co., National Fire Insurance Company of Hartford, Transportation Insurance Co., and Valley Forge Insurance Co., agreed to pay approximately $658,532 in refunds, $312,338 in unpaid tax, and a $150,000 penalty in settlement of allegations they overcharged policyholders in an Emergency Assessment Program from 2009 to 2018.
